sections.title: AHA Accredited
sections.content: This protocol follows American Heart Association Basic Life Support guidelines. For certification, complete an official AHA course.

steps.title: Check Adult Response
steps.subtitle: Tap shoulders firmly and shout: 'Are you OK? Can you hear me?' Check for Breathing and Carotid Pulse no more than 10 seconds.

steps.title: Call for Help
steps.subtitle: Call 911 immediately. Ask someone to find an AED. Start CPR right away.

steps.title: Position Adult
steps.subtitle: Place person on firm surface. Tilt head back, lift chin to open airway.

steps.title: Hand Position
steps.subtitle: Place heel of one hand on center of chest between nipples. Place other hand on top, interlace fingers.

steps.title: Start Compressions
steps.subtitle: Push hard and fast with both hands. Keep arms straight. Allow complete chest recoil.

steps.title: Rescue Breaths
steps.subtitle: Tilt head, lift chin. Pinch nose, seal mouth. Give 2 breaths, each lasting 1 second.

steps.title: Check Child Response
steps.subtitle: Tap shoulders gently and call their name. Look for normal breathing for no more than 10 seconds.

steps.title: Call for Help
steps.subtitle: If alone, perform CPR for 2 minutes first, then call 911. If someone is with you, have them call immediately.

steps.title: Position Child
steps.subtitle: Place child on firm surface. Tilt head back slightly, lift chin to open airway.

steps.title: Hand Position
steps.subtitle: Use one or two hands (depending on child's size) on center of chest between nipples.

details.depth: About 2 inches (5 cm) or 1/3 chest depth.

steps.title: Start Compressions
steps.subtitle: Push hard and fast. Keep arms straight. Allow complete chest recoil between compressions.

details.depth: About 2 inches (5 cm) or 1/3 chest depth.

steps.title: Rescue Breaths
steps.subtitle: Tilt head, lift chin. Pinch nose, seal mouth. Give 2 gentle breaths, each lasting 1 second.

steps.title: Check Infant Response
steps.subtitle: Tap bottom of feet gently. Look for normal breathing for no more than 10 seconds.

steps.title: Call for Help
steps.subtitle: If alone, perform CPR for 2 minutes first, then call 911. If someone is with you, have them call immediately.

steps.title: Position Infant
steps.subtitle: Place infant on firm surface. Tilt head back slightly, lift chin gently to open airway.

steps.title: Finger Position
steps.subtitle: Use two fingers (index and middle) on center of chest, just below nipple line.

details.depth: About 1.5 inches (4 cm) or 1/3 chest depth.

steps.title: Start Compressions
steps.subtitle: Push hard and fast with two fingers. Allow complete chest recoil between compressions.

details.depth: About 1.5 inches (4 cm) or 1/3 chest depth.

steps.title: Rescue Breaths
steps.subtitle: Cover infant's nose and mouth with your mouth. Give 2 gentle puffs, each lasting 1 second.
